title: Levitical Duties
shortSummary: Numbers Chapter 4 details the specific duties and responsibilities assigned to the Levite families—Kohathites, Gershonites, and Merarites—in the service and transportation of the tabernacle. It emphasizes the holiness of the sanctuary and the careful obedience required to serve God properly, highlighting the importance of order and reverence in worship.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Exodus and Wilderness Journey

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader of Israel who receives and implements God's commands regarding the Levites' duties.

keyCharacters.name: Aaron
keyCharacters.description: The high priest who, along with his sons, is responsible for covering the holy objects before the Kohathites carry them.

keyCharacters.name: Eleazar
keyCharacters.description: Son of Aaron, entrusted with the oversight of the oil for the light, incense, meat offering, anointing oil, and all tabernacle vessels.

keyCharacters.name: Ithamar
keyCharacters.description: Son of Aaron, given charge over the service and burdens of the Gershonites and Merarites.

definitions.definition: A durable covering material used to protect the holy objects of the tabernacle during transport.
The portable sanctuary where God dwelt among Israel during their wilderness journey.
The sacred objects within the innermost part of the tabernacle, including the Ark of the Covenant.
The twelve loaves of bread placed on the table in the tabernacle, symbolizing God's covenant and provision.

outline.heading: Instructions for Kohathite Service
outline.description: God commands Moses and Aaron regarding the age and duties of the Kohathite Levites, who are responsible for carrying the most holy objects of the tabernacle. Aaron and his sons must first cover these sacred items to prevent death from improper handling.

outline.heading: Instructions for Gershonite Service
outline.description: The Gershonites are assigned the responsibility of carrying the tabernacle curtains, coverings, and related equipment. Their service is overseen by Ithamar, ensuring proper care and transport.

outline.heading: Instructions for Merarite Service
outline.description: The Merarites are tasked with carrying the structural components of the tabernacle such as boards, bars, pillars, and sockets. Their duties are also under the supervision of Ithamar.

outline.heading: Census and Summary of Levite Service
outline.description: Moses, Aaron, and the leaders number the Levites from thirty to fifty years old who are able to serve. The total number of Levites assigned to the tabernacle service is 8,580, reflecting God's organized provision for worship.

application: Obey God's instructions carefully, recognizing the holiness of His service and the importance of reverence in worship.
Respect the roles and responsibilities God assigns within the church, supporting those who serve in various capacities.
Approach the things of God with caution and humility, understanding that improper handling of sacred matters can have serious consequences.
Commit to faithful service in the body of Christ, knowing that every role is vital for the health and function of the church.

keyVerses.text: And when Aaron and his sons have made an end of covering the sanctuary, and all the vessels of the sanctuary, as the camp is to set forward; after that, the sons of Kohath shall come to bear it: but they shall not touch any holy thing, lest they die. These things are the burden of the sons of Kohath in the tabernacle of the congregation.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the holiness of God's sanctuary and the necessity of obedience and reverence in handling sacred things.

keyVerses.text: From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old, every one that came to do the service of the ministry, and the service of the burden in the tabernacle of the congregation,
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the age and readiness required for service, emphasizing God's order and provision in ministry.

keyVerses.text: And to the office of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest pertaineth the oil for the light, and the sweet incense, and the daily meat offering, and the anointing oil, and the oversight of all the tabernacle, and of all that therein is, in the sanctuary, and in the vessels thereof.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows the special responsibilities given to Eleazar, illustrating the importance of faithful stewardship in worship.
